alert.note: Alert for Daviess (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 04 at 11:12PM CDT until August 05 at 9:37PM CDT by NWS Kansas City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 AM CDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of north central Missouri and northwest Missouri, including the following counties, in north central Missouri, Caldwell, Daviess, Grundy, Harrison, Livingston and Mercer. In northwest Missouri, DeKalb, Gentry and Worth. * WHEN...Until 1115 AM CDT Saturday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1112 PM CDT, the transportation department reported heavy rain in the warned area due to thunderstorms. Flooding is already occurring and numerous roads in the warning area are closed or impassable. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Trenton, Bethany, Gallatin, Albany, Maysville, Princeton, Jamesport, Ridgeway, Gilman City, Pattonsburg, Mercer, Eagleville, New Hampton, Cainsville, Spickard, Kidder, Winston, Altamont, Blythedale and Coffey. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
